intro: Autonoe dasyantha, commonly known as the broad-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
